item.name: Fortune-Teller's Trinket
entries: Diese verschnörkelte Planchette ist mit Perlmutt eingelegt und hält einen Kristallbetrachter. Der Blick durch den Betrachter erlaubt es dem Besitzer, einmal pro Tag {@spell clairvoyance} zu zaubern.

item.name: Brawler's Bangle
entries: Dieses Armband ist aus Rosé- und Gelbgold gefertigt. Während er es trägt, gilt der Träger immer als bewaffnet. Unbewaffnete Schläge erhalten +2 auf Treffer und verursachen Schaden in Höhe von {@dice 1d6 + 2} + Stärke-Modifikator. Schaden, der auf diese Weise zugefügt wird, gilt als magisch, wenn es darum geht, Schadensimmunität/-resistenz zu überwinden.

item.name: Illusionist's Monocle
entries: Die dicke rubinrote Linse dieses onyxumrahmten Monokels ist mit einer unsichtbaren Schnur am Träger befestigt. Ursprünglich von einem mächtigen Zauberer angefertigt, der die gefiederten Katzenwiesel studiert hat, erlaubt dieses Okular dem Träger, durch alle Illusionen hindurchzusehen.
Obwohl er nur über einem Auge getragen wird, wird davon ausgegangen, dass dieser Gegenstand den gesamten Ausrüstungsplatz für die Augen belegt.

item.name: Allusionist's Spectacles
entries: Die dünnen Beryllgläser dieser stahlumrahmten Brille sind mit einer unsichtbaren Schnur am Träger befestigt. Ursprünglich von einem zweitklassigen Barden (der auf den Erfolg von {@item Illusionist's Monocle|GemhammerDoPhse|his Illusionist friend} eifersüchtig geworden war) hergestellt, erlauben diese Brillen dem Träger, jeden Hinweis oder jede Anspielung schnell zu verstehen, indem sie ihm einen Vorteil bei Intelligenzfähigkeiten und auf Intelligenz basierenden Fertigkeitsprüfungen geben.

item.name: Wall Builder's Hammer
entries: Dieser +1 leichte Hammer ist mit vier Halbedelsteinen eingelegt. Als Aktion kann der Träger ein Befehlswort sprechen und auf den Boden schlagen, um einen der folgenden Zauber zu wirken (Spruchschutz DC 18):
Wenn sie benutzt werden, verliert der entsprechende Edelstein seinen Glanz und wird sichtbar stumpfer. Die Edelsteine laden sich alle sieben Tage bei Sonnenaufgang wieder auf.

item.name: Jade Splitter
entries: Dieses +3 Kurzschwert ist mächtig, aber instabil. Bei einem Angriff zersplittert die Klinge bei einem Wurf von {@dice d20} 1 und fügt dem Träger {@dice 2d6} Hiebschaden zu. Einmal zerbrochen, formt sich das Schwert im Morgengrauen aus seinen Scherben neu.

item.name: Ursa Major
entries: Dieses +1-Kurzschwert verströmt ein schwaches violettes Glühen und verursacht bei einem Treffer zusätzlichen {@dice 1d4} psychischen Schaden. Wenn es mit {@item Ursa Minor|GemhammerDoPhse} geführt wird, erhöht sich der Bonus-Psychoschaden auf {@dice 1d6}.

item.name: Ursa Minor
entries: Dieser +1-Dolch verströmt ein schwaches violettes Glühen und verursacht bei einem Treffer zusätzlichen {@dice 1d4} psychischen Schaden. Wenn er mit {@item Ursa Major|GemhammerDoPhse} geführt wird, erhöht sich der Bonus-Psychoschaden auf {@dice 1d6}.

item.name: The Red Wolf's Horn
entries: Dieses {@creature aurochs|vgm} Horn ist mit Beschlägen aus Gold und Rubinen in Form eines Wolfskopfes versehen. Eine Kreatur kann eine Aktion ausgeben, um das Befehlswort des Horns zu sprechen, wodurch es sich mit einem Getränk ihrer Wahl füllt.

Wenn der Trinker aus dem Horn trinkt, kann er {@dice 1d4} von seinem Weisheitswert abziehen und ihn zu seinem Stärkewert addieren. Jedes Mal, wenn eine Kreatur diesen Effekt innerhalb desselben wachen Tages nutzt, muss sie einen Rettungswurf der Konstitution von DC 10 bestehen oder {@condition unconscious} fallen. Der Schutz-DC erhöht sich mit jedem weiteren Getränk um 5.

item.name: All Father's Ravens
entries: Diese aus Mithral und Adamantin gefertigten Zwillinge {@item dagger|phb|daggers} gewähren einen Bonus von +3 auf Angriff und Schaden, wenn sie geworfen werden. Wenn sie jedoch als Nahkampfwaffe eingesetzt werden, haben diese Dolche einen Malus von -3 auf Angriff und Schaden.
Immer wenn diese Dolche geworfen werden, kehren sie am Ende des Zuges in die Hand des Werfers zurück. Diese Dolche gelten für die Zwecke der Einstimmung als ein Gegenstand.

item.name: Stagskin Striders
entries: These knee-high boots are made from the hindquarters of a {@creature giant elk}. If the wearer moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits with a melee attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

item.name: Fox Gloves
entries: These magical gloves appear to have been grown from some kind of giant flower, rather than made by hand. While wearing these gloves a ceature's unarmed strikes and attacks with weapons made from raw natural materials (such as a {@item quarterstaff|phb} or {@item club|phb}) gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls, as well as an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage on hit.

item.name: Vulcanist's Helm
entries: This magical helmet has 3 charges that replenish daily at dawn. The wearer may use an action to spend 1 charge to control any molten rock or metal (per the {@spell control water} spell), or 2 sharges to summon a 1' cube of lava on the ground in a spot within 15 feet that the wearer can see.

Any creature that comes into contact with the lava must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the lava must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The cube maintains its general shape, cooling off in 1 minute.

item.name: Hunter's Folly
entries: This +1 heavy crossbow will not allow itself to miss. If the wielder fires a bolt from this crossbow and misses, the bolt continues to fly around randomly until it hits any creature. The bolt can move up to 50 feet and repeat the attack roll with the wielder's modifier each round at the end of their turn. The DM will determine the direction the bolt flies.

Following a hit, or when another bolt is fired from this crossbow that misses, the bolt becomes inanimate and nonmagical. If the bolt strikes a surface or inanimate object, it deflects harmlessly off it.

item.name: Chromatic Spear
entries: This +1 spear appears to be made of a colored glass that's harder than steel. When attacking with this weapon, the wielder may choose the damage type from the following: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

item.name: Mage Axe
entries: Any spellcaster wielding this {@item quarterstaff|phb} gains proficiency in staffs and battleaxes while it is attuned. Attacks with this weapon are magical for the purposes of overcoming damage immunity/resistance.

This weapon has one charge that replenishes daily at dawn. As a bonus action, the wielder may speak a command word to expend one charge and transform this weapon into a +1 battleaxe for a number of turns equal to their Intelligence modifier. Attacks made from this weapon while it is transformed use the wielder's Intelligence modifier instead of Strength, and deal force damage instead of slashing. The wielder may channel one spell slot of any level into the weapon to gain a number of charges up to the slot's level. If unused, these charges expire at dawn.

item.name: Potion of Hypnosis
entries: This sparkling purple syrup causes the drinker to become highly susceptible to suggestion. The first creature that suggests a direct course of action compels the drinker to follow through per the {@spell suggestion} spell upon a failed DC 13 Charisma saving throw. The effects of this potion end once the drinker completes the compelled action or after a number of hours equal to 8 minus the drinker's Constitution modifier (maximum of 8 hours), whichever comes first.

item.name: Potion of Regeneration
entries: This bright red potion glimmers if shaken. Any creature that drinks this potion regains {@dice 1d6 + 6} hit points at the end of every round for 5 minutes. Once the effects wear off, the drinker immediately suffers 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

item.name: Potion of Greater Regeneration
entries: This bright red potion glimmers if shaken. Any creature that drinks this potion regains {@dice 2d6 + 8} hit points at the end of every round for 5 minutes. Once the effects wear off, the drinker immediately suffers 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} and is {@condition stunned} for 1 round.

item.name: Potion of Superior Regeneration
entries: This bright red potion glimmers if shaken. Any creature that drinks this potion regains {@dice 4d6 + 10} hit points at the end of every round for 5 minutes. Once the effects wear off, the drinker immediately suffers 3 levels of {@condition exhaustion} and is {@condition stunned} for 2 rounds.

item.name: Potion of Supreme Regeneration
entries: This bright red potion glimmers if shaken. Any creature that drinks this potion regains {@dice 8d6 + 14} hit points at the end of every round for 5 minutes. Once the effects wear off, the drinker immediately suffers 5 levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

item.name: Potion of Energy Rejection
entries: This pale yellow syrup is highly viscous and tastes like peaches. After drinking this potion, any spell attack roll targeting the drinker is repelled back to the caster. This effects lasts a number of rounds equal to the drinker's Constitution modifier.

item.name: Potion of Greater Mass
entries: This heavy green liquid feels much heavier than a standard potion, and sits like a brick in the drinker's stomach. For 1 minute, the drinker's weight is multiplied by 20, but they do not change in size. Their speed is reduced to 5 and they have disadvantage on all Dexterity checks and saving throws. Their armor class increases by 5, their Strength score increases to 19 if it isn't already higher, and they gain advantage on all Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

item.name: Potion of Ability Absorption

entries: Note: I have been unable to balance this item reasonably for 5e, but I have included its original unedited description for the sake of completion. ~Ember

A blue liquid with no smell or taste. After you drink this potion, the next attack, spell, or ability that hits you, becomes programmed into your mind. For the next hour you can perform the ability on your turn as a bonus action using the stats of the source of the ability.

item.name: Scroll of Snake Eyes
entries: Using a bonus action to read the scroll conjurs two {@creature poisonous snake|mm|snakes} with whom you share a telepathic link. For 1 hour, or until you dismiss the effect as an action, you are {@condition blinded}, but you can see through the snakes' eyes and give them commands as a bonus action. In combat, the snakes act at the end of your turn. Upon dismissal of the spell, the snakes disappear. If the snakes are killed before the spell ends, you remain blinded for 1 minute.

item.name: Scroll of Recharge
entries: Reading this scroll takes one minute. Upon completion, up to 10 willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet gain the benefits of a night's rest. Spell slots, magic items, and abilities that refresh after a long rest are returned as if a long rest had been completed. Hit points may be recovered as if a short rest had been completed following hit dice return. However, this scroll does not prevent {@condition exhaustion}.

item.name: Scroll of Cannon Burst
entries: As an action, you can read this scroll to explode into a living projectile. You launch in a direction of your choice at a speed of 150 feet per round for 3 rounds. When the spell ends, or you collide with something, the magical energy explodes, dealing {@dice 8d8} fire damage and {@dice 4d8} force damage to each creature within 60 feet that fails a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw (half as much damage on a successful one). You take half as much damage on a failed DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, and no damage on a successful one.

item.name: Scroll of Moon Ray
entries: Using an action to read this scroll conjures 6 rays of ghostly flame, hurling them at one or more targets within range. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw for each ray or take {@dice 1d6} radiant damage, or no damage on a successful save. A shapechanger hit by this attack is forced to revert to its original form.

item.name: 25% Off Coupon
entries: A 25% off discount coupon to Matt's Magic Emporium, wherever in the world that is...

item.name: An I.O.U. for a Soul
entries: An I.O.U. signed by Demogordon, the friendly demon. It may be best not to look into this...

item.name: The Deed to a Mage's Tower
entries: A crude drawing of a seaside tower along with a map showing its location. There is no name or seal on the deed.

item.name: The Deed to a Silver Mine
entries: A crude drawing of a {@item miner's pick|phb} along with a map showing the location of a mine. There is no name or seal on the deed.

item.name: The Deed to a Ship
entries: A crude drawing of a {@item sailing ship} along with a map showing its location. There is no name or seal on the deed.
